t: Numbers 1
The Census
The*p Lord*s spoke to Moses in the tent of meeting in the Desert of Sinai on the first day of the second month of the second year after the Israelites came out of Egypt. He said:
“Take a census of the whole Israelite community by their clans and families, listing every man by name, one by one.
You and Aaron are to count according to their divisions all the men in Israel who are twenty years old or more and able to serve in the army.
One man from each tribe, each of them the head of his family, is to help you.
These are the names of the men who are to assist you: from*pln Reuben, Elizur son of Shedeur;
from*ln Simeon, Shelumiel son of Zurishaddai;
from*ln Judah, Nahshon son of Amminadab;
from*ln Issachar, Nethanel son of Zuar;
from*ln Zebulun, Eliab son of Helon;
from*ln the sons of Joseph: from*ld Ephraim, Elishama son of Ammihud; from*ld Manasseh, Gamaliel son of Pedahzur;
from*ln Benjamin, Abidan son of Gideoni;
from*ln Dan, Ahiezer son of Ammishaddai;
from*ln Asher, Pagiel son of Okran;
from*ln Gad, Eliasaph son of Deuel;
from*ln Naphtali, Ahira son of Enan.”
These*p were the men appointed from the community, the leaders of their ancestral tribes. They were the heads of the clans of Israel.
Moses*p and Aaron took these men whose names had been specified,

and they called the whole community together on the first day of the second month. The people registered their ancestry by their clans and families, and the men twenty years old or more were listed by name, one by one,
as the Lord*s commanded Moses. And so he counted them in the Desert of Sinai:

From*pln the descendants of Reuben the firstborn son of Israel: All*ld the men twenty years old or more who were able to serve in the army were listed by name, one by one, according to the records of their clans and families.
The number from the tribe of Reuben was 46,500.

From*pln the descendants of Simeon: All*ld the men twenty years old or more who were able to serve in the army were counted and listed by name, one by one, according to the records of their clans and families.
The number from the tribe of Simeon was 59,300.
From*pln the descendants of Gad: All*ld the men twenty years old or more who were able to serve in the army were listed by name, according to the records of their clans and families.
The number from the tribe of Gad was 45,650.
From*pln the descendants of Judah: All*ld the men twenty years old or more who were able to serve in the army were listed by name, according to the records of their clans and families.
The number from the tribe of Judah was 74,600.
From*pln the descendants of Issachar: All*ld the men twenty years old or more who were able to serve in the army were listed by name, according to the records of their clans and families.
The number from the tribe of Issachar was 54,400.
From*pln the descendants of Zebulun: All*ld the men twenty years old or more who were able to serve in the army were listed by name, according to the records of their clans and families.
The number from the tribe of Zebulun was 57,400.

From*pld the sons of Joseph: From*ln the descendants of Ephraim: All*ld the men twenty years old or more who were able to serve in the army were listed by name, according to the records of their clans and families.
The number from the tribe of Ephraim was 40,500.
From*ln the descendants of Manasseh: All*ld the men twenty years old or more who were able to serve in the army were listed by name, according to the records of their clans and families.
The number from the tribe of Manasseh was 32,200.
From*pln the descendants of Benjamin: All*ld the men twenty years old or more who were able to serve in the army were listed by name, according to the records of their clans and families.
The number from the tribe of Benjamin was 35,400.
From*pln the descendants of Dan: All*ld the men twenty years old or more who were able to serve in the army were listed by name, according to the records of their clans and families.
The number from the tribe of Dan was 62,700.
From*pln the descendants of Asher: All*ld the men twenty years old or more who were able to serve in the army were listed by name, according to the records of their clans and families.
The number from the tribe of Asher was 41,500.
From*pln the descendants of Naphtali: All*ld the men twenty years old or more who were able to serve in the army were listed by name, according to the records of their clans and families.
The number from the tribe of Naphtali was 53,400.
These*p were the men counted by Moses and Aaron and the twelve leaders of Israel, each one representing his family.
All the Israelites twenty years old or more who were able to serve in Israel’s army were counted according to their families.
The total number was 603,550.
The*p ancestral tribe of the Levites, however, was not counted along with the others.
The Lord*s had said to Moses:
“You must not count the tribe of Levi or include them in the census of the other Israelites.

Instead, appoint the Levites to be in charge of the tabernacle of the covenant law—over all its furnishings and everything belonging to it. They are to carry the tabernacle and all its furnishings; they are to take care of it and encamp around it.
Whenever the tabernacle is to move, the Levites are to take it down, and whenever the tabernacle is to be set up, the Levites shall do it. Anyone else who approaches it is to be put to death.
The Israelites are to set up their tents by divisions, each of them in their own camp under their standard.

The Levites, however, are to set up their tents around the tabernacle of the covenant law so that my wrath will not fall on the Israelite community. The Levites are to be responsible for the care of the tabernacle of the covenant law.”
The*p Israelites did all this just as the Lord*s commanded Moses.
